learning_outcomes.description: understand the roles of a sport scientist & strength & conditioning coach within the high performance support team and be able to operate within a team environment.
understand and utilise performance analysis tools to assess the demands of training and competition.
be able to interpret physiological and biomechanical test data to assess the strengths and weaknesses of an athlete
develop optimal training recommendations encompassing all aspects of athletic preparation
understand the importance of recovery and the many factors that contribute to an athlete becoming overtrained
be able to develop and critically defend a periodised training program
be able to critically review academic literature and then apply the findings to a practical sport science setting
work effectively within a student team to develop communication and process management skills, and facilitate peer-assisted collaborative learning

assessments.due_date:
11/08/2025 2:00 pm

Completed online during timetabled exam 1 activity.
assessments.task_description:
The Week 3 Quiz is your chance to check in, test your knowledge, and show how well you're engaging with the course so far! Covering content from lectures, readings, and workshops, the quiz will help you stay on track and build confidence early in the semester.

You’ll complete 10 questions in 10 minutes, so be ready to think fast and apply what you’ve learned.

Please note that it is relatively common for computer problems to occur on personal systems or with the online system. It can be very difficult to document some problems, which makes it impossible for the us to take these into account. You must complete your quiz during the allocated time - so that you have time to successfully resolve any problems that might occur.

The quiz will consist of Multiple Choice Questions on the content covered in weeks 1 and 2. 

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) 

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be completed as an online quiz via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The In-Semester Examination is your opportunity to demonstrate what you’ve learned so far — and to build momentum for the rest of the course!

You’ll have 60 minutes to tackle 60 multiple-choice questions, all designed to challenge your understanding and sharpen your ability to apply course concepts.

Covering content and readings from Weeks 1 to 8, as well as material explored in workshops, this assessment is a great chance to reflect on your progress, reinforce your learning, and show what you know.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
In this major assessment, students will draw on the semester’s learnings to design a comprehensive, evidence-based training program tailored to a specific sport and athlete population. You will deliver a 10-12 minute in-person oral presentation in groups of no more than three students that critically analyses your decisions and showcases your ability to integrate sport science theory into practice across physical, technical, tactical, and psychological domains.

You will be required to:

  • Conduct a needs analysis for a chosen team, identifying the sport-specific demands across all performance domains
  • Develop a 12-month periodised training plan incorporating evidence-informed methods
  • Present two detailed microcycles (preseason and competition) with justifications for training methods and design variables
  • Critically evaluate your program and articulate how it supports holistic athlete development

Presentation Requirements:

  • Students must present for between 10 to 12 minutes in person plus questions. Any content extending beyond 12 minutes will not be assessed.
  • Students can use a slide show to aid their presentation.
  • Students are discouraged from relying on notes during their presentation.
  • You may use slides but should limit reliance on notes
  • Students are to record their presentation using video software such as Zoom or Microsoft Teams. Your faces must be clearly visible with high quality sound. In view, must be each person's face along with the respective slide projection.

This is your opportunity to demonstrate your ability to synthesise knowledge, justify practice, and communicate with clarity and confidence—essential skills for professionals working with high-performance athletes.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) 

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The Final Examination will give you the chance to showcase everything you’ve learned across the semester.

You’ll have 60 minutes to complete 60 multiple-choice questions all designed to assess your understanding of key concepts, critical thinking, and application of theory to practice.

The exam will draw on material covered from Weeks 1 to 13, including lectures, readings, and workshop activities available through Learn.UQ. This is your opportunity to demonstrate your growth, insight, and readiness to apply your knowledge in real-world professional contexts.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Dimensions of athlete preparation

No in-person class this week. Students are required to complete online work through Learn.UQ
learning_activities.topic_description: Dimensions of athlete preparation No in-person class this week. Students are required to complete online work through Learn.UQ

learning_activities.topic:
Strength and Power

Get ready to unleash explosive performance! In this week’s workshop, you’ll dive into the art and science of strength and power periodisation—exploring how to strategically plan and progress training to maximise force, speed, and athletic output. You’ll break down real-world examples, apply evidence-based methods, and develop your own periodised models designed to elevate athlete performance to the next level.

Learning outcomes: L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Strength and Power Get ready to unleash explosive performance! In this week’s workshop, you’ll dive into the art and science of strength and power periodisation —exploring how to strategically plan and progress training to maximise force, speed, and athletic output. You’ll break down real-world examples, apply evidence-based methods, and develop your own periodised models designed to elevate athlete performance to the next level.

learning_activities.topic:
Speed, Agilty and Endurance

Shift gears and accelerate performance! This week focuses on the science and strategy behind speed and agility periodisation. You’ll explore how to structure training phases that build explosive acceleration, sharp change of direction, and game-changing agility. You’ll learn how to tailor speed-focused programs that meet the demands of elite sport and keep athletes moving at their peak, all season long.

Learning outcomes: L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Speed, Agilty and Endurance Shift gears and accelerate performance! This week focuses on the science and strategy behind speed and agility periodisation . You’ll explore how to structure training phases that build explosive acceleration, sharp change of direction, and game-changing agility. You’ll learn how to tailor speed-focused programs that meet the demands of elite sport and keep athletes moving at their peak, all season long.

learning_activities.topic:
Periodisation for maximum performance

Train smart, perform sharper! This week’s workshop unlocks the keys to managing training load for peak performance. You’ll explore how to balance stress and recovery, avoid overtraining, and fine-tune athlete readiness using monitoring tools and load management strategies. Learn how to optimise performance by making data-informed decisions that keep athletes progressing, adapting, and performing at their best when it matters most.

Learning outcomes: L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Periodisation for maximum performance Train smart, perform sharper! This week’s workshop unlocks the keys to managing training load for peak performance . You’ll explore how to balance stress and recovery, avoid overtraining, and fine-tune athlete readiness using monitoring tools and load management strategies. Learn how to optimise performance by making data-informed decisions that keep athletes progressing, adapting, and performing at their best when it matters most.

learning_activities.topic:
Tapering and peaking

Finish strong with precision! This week explores the power of tapering—the strategic reduction of training load to unleash peak performance at the right moment. You’ll learn how to design tapering strategies that maintain fitness, reduce fatigue, and optimise physiological and psychological readiness. Discover how elite athletes time their best performances through well-executed taper plans that bring it all together when it counts most.

Learning outcomes: L04, L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Tapering and peaking Finish strong with precision! This week explores the power of tapering —the strategic reduction of training load to unleash peak performance at the right moment. You’ll learn how to design tapering strategies that maintain fitness, reduce fatigue, and optimise physiological and psychological readiness. Discover how elite athletes time their best performances through well-executed taper plans that bring it all together when it counts most.

learning_activities.topic:
Athlete Monitoring

Unlock elite potential! This week’s workshop dives into the integrated strategies that drive optimal athletic performance across the season. You’ll explore how to align long-term development frameworks with cutting-edge monitoring practices to enhance athlete progression, resilience, and results. From training adjustments to performance tracking, you’ll learn how to make smart, data-driven decisions that support sustainable success at the highest level.

Learning outcomes: L04, L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Athlete Monitoring Unlock elite potential! This week’s workshop dives into the integrated strategies that drive optimal athletic performance across the season. You’ll explore how to align long-term development frameworks with cutting-edge monitoring practices to enhance athlete progression, resilience, and results. From training adjustments to performance tracking, you’ll learn how to make smart, data-driven decisions that support sustainable success at the highest level.

learning_activities.topic:
Performance Analysis & Analytics

See the science come to life! This week brings periodised training models into real-world focus. You’ll analyse how elite teams and athletes structure their seasons using tailored, adaptive plans that respond to the evolving demands of competition. Through case studies and applied examples, you’ll gain practical insight into how periodisation is implemented across different sports to maximise performance, manage fatigue, and maintain competitive edge.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Performance Analysis & Analytics See the science come to life! This week brings periodised training models into real-world focus. You’ll analyse how elite teams and athletes structure their seasons using tailored, adaptive plans that respond to the evolving demands of competition. Through case studies and applied examples, you’ll gain practical insight into how periodisation is implemented across different sports to maximise performance, manage fatigue, and maintain competitive edge.

learning_activities.topic:
Skill Acquisition

Plan the path to podium performance! In this week’s workshop, you’ll master the art of annual training planning and periodisation. Learn how to map out a full season of training that strategically balances progression, performance, and recovery. You’ll explore how to structure macro-, meso-, and micro-cycles to align with competition calendars, developmental stages, and performance goals—giving athletes the best chance to peak at the right time.

Learning outcomes: L03, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Skill Acquisition Plan the path to podium performance! In this week’s workshop, you’ll master the art of annual training planning and periodisation . Learn how to map out a full season of training that strategically balances progression, performance, and recovery. You’ll explore how to structure macro-, meso-, and micro-cycles to align with competition calendars, developmental stages, and performance goals—giving athletes the best chance to peak at the right time.

learning_activities.topic:
Training elite Paralympic athletes

Build smarter programs from the ground up! This week focuses on conducting an integrated needs analysis—the essential foundation for designing effective, individualised training plans. You’ll learn how to assess the physical, technical, tactical, and psychological demands of a sport, while also considering athlete-specific factors like development stage, competition level, and injury history. This holistic approach will help you craft targeted programs that truly meet the needs of athletes and their performance environment.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Training elite Paralympic athletes Build smarter programs from the ground up! This week focuses on conducting an integrated needs analysis —the essential foundation for designing effective, individualised training plans. You’ll learn how to assess the physical, technical, tactical, and psychological demands of a sport, while also considering athlete-specific factors like development stage, competition level, and injury history. This holistic approach will help you craft targeted programs that truly meet the needs of athletes and their performance environment.

learning_activities.topic:
Sports Psychology Tools

In Week 10, we shift focus to the psychological tools and strategies that support elite athlete development and performance. You’ll explore how mindfulness, self-regulation, and mental resilience contribute to high-performance outcomes across sporting contexts.

Learning outcomes: L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Sports Psychology Tools In Week 10, we shift focus to the psychological tools and strategies that support elite athlete development and performance. You’ll explore how mindfulness, self-regulation, and mental resilience contribute to high-performance outcomes across sporting contexts.

learning_activities.topic:
Mindset for Athletic Performance

In Week 11, we dive into the power of mindset as a tool for enhancing athletic performance. You’ll explore how mental framing, grit, and stress optimisation can shape outcomes in elite sport, and how psychological resilience can be developed alongside physical capability. This week challenges you to consider how mindset strategies can be integrated into training environments to support consistent, high-level performance.

Learning outcomes: L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Mindset for Athletic Performance In Week 11, we dive into the power of mindset as a tool for enhancing athletic performance. You’ll explore how mental framing, grit, and stress optimisation can shape outcomes in elite sport, and how psychological resilience can be developed alongside physical capability. This week challenges you to consider how mindset strategies can be integrated into training environments to support consistent, high-level performance.

learning_activities.topic:
Nutrition for Sports Performance

In Week 12, we focus on nutrition strategies within a periodised training model, exploring how tailored nutritional planning can enhance performance, recovery, and long-term athlete development. You'll examine the latest research and practical frameworks for aligning nutrition with the demands of different training phases and competitive cycles.

Learning outcomes: L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Nutrition for Sports Performance In Week 12, we focus on nutrition strategies within a periodised training model, exploring how tailored nutritional planning can enhance performance, recovery, and long-term athlete development. You'll examine the latest research and practical frameworks for aligning nutrition with the demands of different training phases and competitive cycles.

learning_activities.topic:
Mentoring in high performance sport

In Week 13, we explore the role of mentoring in high-performance sport, highlighting how strong developmental networks support athlete growth, coach effectiveness, and long-term success. You’ll examine the qualities of effective mentors, the dynamics of mentoring relationships, and how these contribute to building sustainable high-performance environments.
learning_activities.topic_description: Mentoring in high performance sport In Week 13, we explore the role of mentoring in high-performance sport , highlighting how strong developmental networks support athlete growth, coach effectiveness, and long-term success. You’ll examine the qualities of effective mentors, the dynamics of mentoring relationships, and how these contribute to building sustainable high-performance environments.
